title: What time are the Brit Awards 2017 on TV tonight, what channel are they on, who’s hosting and how can I watch?
text:
TV Magazine winner takes all What time are the Brit Awards 2017 on TV tonight, what channel are they on, who’s hosting and how can I watch? 
Planning to watch the legendary awards ceremony? Here are all the details... BY LAUREN WINDLE Click to share on Facebook (Opens in new window) Comments IT’S WHERE Madonna fell down the stairs, Adele gave producers the middle finger and Robbie challenged Noel Gallagher to a fight. 
There is never a shortage of drama at the BRIT awards and tonight’s ceremony is set to be bigger and better than ever. 
Here’s the lowdon on one of the biggest nights in British music… ITV Dermot O’Leary and an excited Emma Willis are hosting this year’s BRIT awards When are The BRITs? 
The annual event is scheduled for tonight, February 22 and will take place in London’s O2 Arena. 
For the first time ever, the nominations were announced in a LIVE show on Saturday January 14 on ITV . 
The show unveiled the artists in the running for the coveted BRIT Awards trophies in the various categories including British Single, British Breakthrough and MasterCard British Album of the Year. 
However, the event was marred by X Factor star Olly Murs pulling out of his scheduled performance – because he was “gutted” not to receive a single nomination. Justin Bieber performs at the BRIT Awards What time are the BRITs on TV and how can I follow the awards? 
The 2017 BRIT Awards will be aired on ITV at 7.30pm on February 22. 
If TV is not enough you can start following the action now via the official Twitter handle , Facebook page and YouTube channel . 
For international fans the event is being livestreamed on YouTube and fronted by vlogger Caspar Lee . 
And if you want to get even more social there's also Snapchat and Tumblr . Who is presenting The BRITs? 
This year, ITV favourites Ant and Dec had been replaced in favour of charismatic crooner Michael Bublé. 
However, Dan Wootton revealed Michael Buble would not be hosting the awards, due to his son Noah's sad cancer diagnosis. 
A source said: “It was a difficult call but Michael has decided to pull out of hosting the Brit Awards. 
“Out of respect for Michael the producers gave him as much time as he needed to make the decision, which they completely understood. Getty Images 3 Previous BRIT hosts Ant and Dec have stepped down 
“He would have put a unique stamp on the night so it’s a real shame, but at the moment his priority is his family. 
“They are exploring other options now about who will take his place and a number of people have thrown their hat in the ring." 
The show will also be streamed live on YouTube, with cheeky vlogger Caspar Lee hosting the digital broadcast. Can I get still tickets for the BRIT Awards? 
Limited tickets are still available from The O2 website , currently the website reads that there are no seats available, however the event is not officially sold out - O2 says it is possible some seats may become available again. 
At £105 (plus fees), they don't come at a cheap price. 
There are no under 13s allowed and children under 17 must be accompanied by an adult. 
If you don't manage to get tickets then you can recreate the Brit magic in your home with their official compilation album which features all the big artists from the night. Getty Images - WireImage Robbie Williams will be collecting the Icon Award at the BRITs tonight Who will be at The BRITs? 
The list of celeb who will be in attendance is as long as your arm and anyone who's anyone will be frocked/suited up for the occasion. 
The full list will be announced nearer the time, but one man who will be there for sure is Robbie Williams. 
The former Take That member is being honoured with The BRITs Icon Award. 
His BRIT shelf is going to need extra reinforcement as he adds the trophy to his collection of 17 awards from previous years. Adele flips the bird after being cut off during her BRITS acceptance speech 
Previous winners of the impressive accolade are Sir Elton John and David Bowie. 
Robbie will perform at the ceremony alongside Little Mix, Emeli Sande, Bruno Marks, Skepta and The 1975. 
Ed Sheeran has confirmed he will be performing at the awards ceremony, along with megastar Katy Perry. 
This will be the Roar singer’s first UK TV appearance in three years. Robbie challenges Liam Gallagher to a fight on stage at The Brits
